node.title: John Lennon's murder, the Cold War and the Red Bikini Girl
node.alt: Yoko Ono and John Lennon stand in the street and pose for the camera.
node.description: John Lennon was gunned down at his New York apartment 41 years ago. Beatles fans remember what they were doing on that day, including reporter Jason Dasey, who was chasing a Soviet defector on Sydney Harbour at the height of the Cold War.
node.content:
["On the day John Lennon was shot dead in New York, a Soviet sailor jumped ship in Sydney Harbour, following in the footsteps of the so-called Red Bikini Girl the year before.", "It was December 8, 1980, and the impact of the Cold War was being felt on both sides of the globe.", "When Lennon was gunned down outside the Dakota Apartments in Manhattan, it came at the end of a year that saw his adopted nation boycott the 1980 Moscow Olympics, with Australia partially supporting the ban.", "In Sydney, 43-year-old Soviet seaman Victor Dudko walked off his ship, Novopolotsk, when it was docked at\u00a0Sydney Harbour and sought refuge in the city's Russian community after a blazing row with his captain.", "The previous year, 18-year-old cruise ship worker Liliana Gasinskaya made an even more brazen escape, leaping through\u00a0a porthole of the SS Leonid Sobinov \u2014 wearing nothing but a red bikini \u2014 and swimming ashore to Pyrmont.", "Days after Dudko's escape, the two would meet and compare notes about leaving the Soviet Union behind for a new country they knew little about. Having been granted political asylum, Liliana became the first cover girl\u00a0for Australian Penthouse magazine in October 1979 \u2014 posing without her red bikini.", "", "
The first edition of Australian Penthouse magazine in 1979\u00a0featured\u00a0Soviet defector Liliana Gasinskaya.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "I broke the story about the second Soviet defection as a teenage reporter\u00a0for The Sydney Morning Herald, hearing whispers at the Maritime Services Board at Circular Quay that a Russian had risked it all to be with his secret Australian girlfriend.\u00a0", "But, just weeks earlier,\u00a0as a Beatles\u00a0tragic,\u00a0I had dreamt of an even bigger story: Flying to the US to interview Lennon about his acclaimed musical comeback after a five-year hiatus.", "
Lennon and defector share front page
", "Little did I know that my first front-page article\u00a0would share column inches with news of the death of one of my musical heroes and I would have to fight back tears to write it.", "The recent release of\u00a0Peter Jackson's Get Back\u00a0\u2014 re-editing previously unused footage from the Let It Be film to create a three-part series on Disney+ \u2014 is helping create a new generation of\u00a0Beatles\u00a0fans.", "", "
Peter Jackson\u2019s Get Back helps a new generation of fans appreciate the genius of John Lennon and the Beatles.
", "And, similarly, Lennon's Double Fantasy album, in collaboration with his wife Yoko Ono \u2014 and Paul McCartney's post-Wings\u00a0release of the innovative McCartney II album, featuring Coming Up \u2014 brought the Beatles back into focus in 1980.", "With the two main men of the group rediscovering\u00a0their musical feet \u2014 and reportedly\u00a0becoming friends again after years of antipathy\u00a0\u2014 could there be the possibility of a Beatles' reunion?", "
Shot dead after studio session for Yoko
", "That dream was shattered on the evening of December 8, when Lennon and Ono returned in their limousine to the Dakota from the Record Plant studios where they had been mixing Ono's Walking on Thin Ice.\u00a0", "", "
John Lennon signs an autograph for Mark Chapman just hours before he was shot dead.(Supplied: gordonandthewhale.com)
", "Exiting the car on 72nd Street, Lennon\u00a0noticed Beatles fan\u00a0Mark David Chapman, to whom he had given an autograph earlier in the day.\u00a0Seconds later, Chapman drew his gun and fired five shots into Lennon from 3\u00a0metres away.", "Despite desperate\u00a0efforts to revive him, Lennon was pronounced dead at 11:15pm at the nearby\u00a0Roosevelt Hospital.", "The news broke in Australia on the afternoon of December 9\u00a0\u2014 a Tuesday\u00a0\u2014\u00a0just as I was wrapping up my interview with Mr Dudko, whom I found\u00a0hiding with a Russian family\u00a0in Sydney's south-western suburbs.", "With the help of a translator, the divorcee explained\u00a0he hadn't defected\u00a0to be with an Australian girlfriend, but to escape the repression of the Soviet Union, tearfully leaving behind two school-age children in the port city of Saint Petersburg.", "I was riding high on adrenaline as I headed back to the Sydney Morning Herald offices with notebook in hand, but my mood\u00a0changed when I saw Brett, one of the newspaper's copy boys,\u00a0sobbing face down on a desk of our\u00a0Broadway office.", "\"Look at this,\" he said, holding up a special edition of our\u00a0afternoon tabloid, The Sun, with the banner headline 'Beatle John Lennon Shot Dead'.", "", "
The mugshot of Mark David Chapman, who is serving a life sentence at the Wende Correctional Facility in New York.(Reuters)
", "My immediate reaction was thinking\u00a0it was one of those dummy newspapers, the kind\u00a0you could buy at theme parks to create any kind of fictitious story.\u00a0Surely, this couldn't be true?", "I looked around the newsroom, and gauging the sombre mood, I quickly realised it\u00a0was not a prank but confirmation of the\u00a0most shocking and violent end for\u00a0a musical legend.\u00a0", "
A growing\u00a0appreciation for the Beatles
", "I enjoyed the Beatles in real-time as a child\u00a0\u2014 my parents took me to the screening of the Yellow Submarine movie and Ob-La-Di Ob-La-Da was my favourite song in primary school.", "", "
Beatles\u00a0fan turned Soviet tracker Jason Dasey in 1980.(Supplied)
", "But I'm too young to\u00a0remember their only Australian tour in 1964. And the so-called summer of love of 1967\u00a0\u2014 when the Beatles released their influential Sgt. Pepper Lonely Hearts Club album\u00a0\u2014 was\u00a0spent in the kindergarten playground playing with Tonka toys and\u00a0eating\u00a0fairy bread sandwiches.", "Like most late Boomers, my appreciation for the Beatles\u00a0grew as a teenager in the 70s. Just weeks before Lennon's murder, I watched the Let It Be film in an arthouse cinema in Sydney's inner-west.", "Lennon was found face down in the reception area of the Dakota and driven to hospital in the back of a New York police car.", "One of Chapman's bullets lodged itself in Lennon's aorta, next to his heart, and medical staff at the Roosevelt Hospital unsuccessfully tried\u00a0to resuscitate\u00a0him for more than 20 minutes.", "Typing up my defector story with senior colleague Ben Sandilands \u2014 this was the pre-computer area \u2014\u00a0I found it hard to concentrate.\u00a0My\u00a0emotions bubbled\u00a0over as I almost refused\u00a0to accept the reality of Lennon's death.\u00a0\u00a0", "", "
Tributes to John Lennon outside the Cavern Club in his birthplace of Liverpool.(Reuters)
", "The defector, Mr Dudko, was starting a new life in Australia full of hope, freedom\u00a0and optimism,\u00a0just as the life of one of my musical heroes\u00a0ended\u00a0in the US.", "
Defector becomes model and soap star
", "The life of Liliana Gasinskaya\u00a0 \u2014 the Red Bikini Girl\u00a0\u2014 had prospered since she started the trend of Australia's Soviet defectors in January 1979.", "She was\u00a0granted refugee status\u00a0within four days of her defection and, apart from her high-profile Penthouse photoshoot \u2014 for which she was reportedly paid $15,000 \u2014 the Ukrainian appeared in episodes of the Young Doctors TV soap\u00a0and was a professional disco dancer and DJ.", "Eyebrows were raised during her meeting with Mr Dudko when she revealed that she had returned to the Soviet Union on holiday earlier that year, to the nation that had supposedly persecuted her.\u00a0", "Today she lives in London\u00a0after her marriage to an Australian property developer fell apart in the late 1980s, according to the UK's Daily Mail.", "Back in\u00a0 1980,\u00a0the front page of the next day's Sydney Morning Herald \u2014 December 10\u00a0\u2014 had more on the Lennon assassination, \"How an autograph-hunter killed Lennon'\"\u00a0above my story, \"Exclusive: the defector talks'\",\u00a0with a photograph of Mr Dudko earnestly walking through the surf at\u00a0Coogee Beach, hands in pockets and his jeans rolled up.", "", "
The front page of The Sydney Morning Herald on December 10, 1980.(Supplied)
", "Like Ms Gasinskaya, Mr Dudko would be allowed to stay in Australia. In 1981, the then-minister of immigration and ethnic affairs, Ian McPhee, granted him permanent immigration status.", "Mr Dudko would land a job as a sheet metal worker at the Peters Ice Cream factory in the Sydney suburb of Seven Hills.", "As the so-called new Australians enjoyed an unfamiliar summer Christmas in 1980, the world ached from the Lennon loss, including his former bandmates.", "A stunned McCartney called\u00a0it \"a drag\", and guitarist George Harrison said it was \"an outrage that people can take other people's lives when they obviously haven't got their own lives in order\", before releasing a tribute song, All Those Years Ago.", "Back in the Soviet Union, news of Lennon's murder\u00a0warranted only a three-paragraph story in the December 10 edition of the\u00a0daily newspaper, Trud.", "However, around 200 to 300 fans quietly paid their respects to Lennon\u00a0at Moscow State University,\u00a0Radio Free Europe reported.", "The Cold War had ensured that only snippets of the Beatles\u00a0and Lennon's music made it through the Iron Curtain.", "But, for me, Lennon's death will always be entwined with the former Soviet Union.", "For that,\u00a0the Beatles' 1968 composition, Back In The USSR\u00a0\u2014 albeit mostly penned by McCartney\u00a0\u2014 holds special significance whenever I think of the day that the genius of John Winston Ono Lennon left us."]
